Job Description:
1. Prepare SOP for operation department
2. Lead the operation of the company
3. Supervise the operation and team to ensure their properly operate the daily and monthly closing task.
4. Support logistic clearance
5. Summary report, manage invoice and follow up AR to ensure timely cash collection
6. Work closely with sales department to identify customer requirement.
7. Work closely with stock Make sure that all goods delivery to the right customer and timely.
8. Work with HR Department regarding recruitment and draft JD.
9. Manage company facilities and environment
10. Work closely with design department for showroom and product upgrades and in case company exhibition.
11. Update customer folder
12. Minute taker……
13. Assist GM as required.
14. Marketing Strategy
15. Able to meet customer
16. Operating all retail outlet tidiness/ stock control.
Job Requirement:
- Excellent organizational skills, great willingness to work, the ability to understand clear instructions and ability to motivate others is required.
- Ability to work under pressure and coordinate numerous activities and groups of people who need to cooperate to achieve maximum efficiency.
- Must be able to lead a team on projects. Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Project).
- Excellent leadership and communication skills
- Good planning and mentoring skills.
- Good English oral and written communication skills.
- Good personality


JA 1181
Salary: Open for negotiation
Work Schedule: 8:00AM - 5:30PM
Holiday: Sat half day / Sun / National Holiday
Benefits: Bonus / Air-conditioned Office / Salary Increase / Skill Improvement / Other benefits are open for negotiation

Job Description:
−	Review monthly sales call & routing of the SR to enhance effective coverage, thus improving the service & distribution. 
−	Verifying & update the respective SR outlet database on a quarterly basis
−	To ensure that all retail outlets within the assigned territory are well stocked with CBL’s products.
−	To assist SR & distributors in solving trade issues
−	To participate together with the SR in negotiation of sponsorship with outlets.
−	To manage the distribution and to ensure that the distributors achieve their set targets. 
−	To assist the BP team in the deployment of Beer Promoters effectively.
−	To guide, train & motivate the SR under their charge
−	To continuously review the sales performance of the SR & distributor under their charge
−	To maximize sales within the outlets through quality merchandising resulting in increased awareness & perfect serve.
−	To assist in implementing promotional activities as assigned.
−	To ensure that all merchandising & POSM adhere to guidelines as per the Trade Marketing Toolkit.
−	Reviewing the allocation & type of POSM of SR to outlets to ensure trade marketing guidelines are adhered to  
−	To generate daily, weekly and monthly sales reports.
−	Additional duties as may be assigned by your superior from time to time.
Job Requirement:
−	Bachelor Degree Sales/Marketing/Business or equivalent  
−	Sales or marketing or business
−	Preferably with 3 years sales experience with other FMCG 
−	(Fast Moving Consumer Goods) companies 
−	Good command of written & spoken English 
−	Good interpersonal skills
−	Must has car driving license 

Cambodia Brewery Limited is an equal opportunity employer and offers a very competitive remuneration package with outstanding long-term career opportunities (13-month salary plus discretionary performance bonus, medical/ health benefits and insurance coverage).


Interested candidates are invited to apply by sending a Cover Letter states the position applying for, CV with expectation salary and a recent photograph, Driving Licenses, Cambodian ID, certificates and other academic records to contact information below, address Robos Angkagne Village, Sangkat Prek Eng, Khan Meanchey, Phnom Penh or # 56, Street 315, Sangkat Boeng Kak I, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh or Email: recruitment@cbl.com.kh , Tel: 023 722 683. All applications will be treated with strictest confidence and only short listed candidates will be contacted.
Company Profile:
The HEINEKEN Company, the world's most international brewer who was formerly known as Cambodia Brewery Limited (CBL). The company was established in Cambodia in 1994 as a joint-venture between Asia Pacific Brewery Limited and Progress Import-Export Company, before becoming 100% HEINEKEN in 2014. 

A career with HEINEKEN offers great challenges combined with exciting opportunities to own and grow your career in line with your aspirations.

HEINEKEN has over 85,000 internationally diverse, dynamic, committed and entrepreneurial employees working in over 70 countries on over 300 brands.

HEINEKEN Cambodia offers several exciting packages including:
- Company Transportation (30 mins from PP)
- Healthy Lunch @our Canteen
- 13th month salary
- Various performance bonuses 
- Insurance plans (Personal Accident & Group Hospital & Surgical)
- Company clinic (with Certified doctors and nurse)
- Training & development programs
- Oversea Training and international assignment opportunities
- Personal Development Plan and more.

Interested candidates shall submit their Application through our Online Application:
careers.theheinekencompany.com/Cambodia/

or send CV & Cover Letter to: hrrecruitments@heineken.com

- តាមដានការរីកចំរើនបរិមាណ និងគុណភាពឥណទានរបស់ខ្លួនទទួលខុសត្រូវ។

Company Profile:
** គ្រឺះស្ថានមីក្រូហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ ជោគជ័យ ភីអិលស៊ី
ជាគ្រឺះស្ថានមីក្រូហិរញ្ញចត្ថុ ត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងនៅ ថ្ងៃទី ១៨ ខែកក្កដា ឆ្នាំ២០១៥ និងទទួលអាជ្ញា ប័ណ្ណពីធនាគារជាតិនៃកម្ពុជា លេខ... ដើម្បីប្រតិបត្តិ ការផ្តល់សេវាប្រាក់កម្ចីជូន ដល់ប្រជាពលរដ្ឋដែល ត្រូវការទុនដើម្បីបង្កើតមុខរបរថ្មី ឬពង្រីកមុខរបរ ដែលមានស្រាប់សំដៅ បង្កើនប្រាក់ចំណូល និងជួយលើកកំពស់សុខមាលភាពសង្គម។

សេវាផ្តល់ឥណទាន
ជោគជ័យ ផ្តល់សេវាប្រាក់កម្ចីដល់ប្រជាពលរដ្ឋ ដែលរស់នៅតាមជនបទ ជាលក្ខណៈ ក្រុម ឯកត្តជន និងឥណទានជំនួញខ្នាតតូចនិងមធ្យម ដែលមានរយៈពេលចាប់ពី ៦សប្តាហ៍ ដល់៦០ ខែ អាស្រ័យលើមុខរបរ និងខួបផលិតកម្មអាជីវកម្ម។

** អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ ពីសេវាប្រាក់កម្ចី
- ខ្ចី និងសងប្រាក់ដល់ផ្ទះលោកអ្នក
- អត្រាការប្រាក់កាន់តែទាបនៅពេលអតិថិជនខ្ចីប្រាក់ច្រើនវគ្ក
- កម្ចីមានច្រើនប្រភេទទៅតាមតម្រូវការ ជាពិសេសកម្ចីខ្នាត តូចដើម្បីជួយសម្រួលការលំបាកអតិថិជន
- សេវាកម្មអតិថិជនល្អដែលផ្តល់ដោយបុគ្គលលិក ជោគជ័យ
- លោកអ្នកចំណេញពេលវេលា និងថវិការច្រើននៅ ពេលប្រើប្រាស់សេវាកម្ចីរបស់គ្រឹស្ថាន
- ធ្វើឲ្យជីវភាពរបស់លោកអ្នកកាន់តែជោគជ័យ និងល្អប្រសើឡើង
- បង់សងត្រឡប់មុនកាលកំណត់ដោយមិនគិតប្រាក់ពិន័យ
- ការប្រាក់គិតទៅតាមសមតុល្យប្រាក់ដើមដែលនៅជំពាក់
- ការប្រាក់គិតត្រឹមតែ៣៦០ថ្ងៃប៉ុណ្ណោះក្នុងមួយឆ្នាំ

Job Description:
Marketing Manager in our Company:
As a  Marketing Manager in our Company you are will involved in developing process of the Company's platform, make it works to enables our partners, and ultimately how it solves customer problems. You are will responsible for planning,
designing and positioning of Company's products, including
development of collateral materials and documentation, defining pricing strategies. You are will responsible for establishing and supporting collaboration with strategy partners and customers of the Company. You are will also work closely with developing, engineering to deliver best-in-class products and to ensure all customer satisfaction goals are met, while supporting the company’s overall strategy and goals.

Job Description

Marketing Manager is expected to:
Develop and implement product go-to-market plans, working with all team to execute
Develop the core positioning, messaging and segmentation for our products
Develop sales support tools including launch collateral
Responsible for customer facing system documentation
Perform product demos to customers
Help define product pricing and strategies
Market Intelligence – expert on buyers and competition, new markets investigation
Develop highly tailored content for presentations, demonstrations, datasheets and white papers
Deliver effective presentations and product demonstrations as needed to support analyst, partner, and prospective customer meetings
Meet with partners and customers for negotiations and direct sale
Act as a leader and facilitator within the company
Job Requirement:
You’re analytical, strategic, a good writer, good in front of
customers
PowerPoint, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator master, strong on Excel
You're curious about applying new technologies
You're driven to solve tough and interesting problems
You want to see the results of your work first hand
You can adapt to changing conditions
You enjoy meeting customers and working to innovate solutions with them
You like start-ups and all that they entail
You're hands on, action oriented, and you care about customers.
You have demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills
You have experience in AGILE product development
You have the proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
You have a at least Bachelor’s degree
You have a minimum of three (3) years experience as a Sale Representative and a minimum of one (1) year experience as a Marketing Manager.

Job Description:
Science laboratory staff work in partnership with science teachers in providing effective learning outcomes for students of science at our school. Science laboratory assistant requires effective communication skills and must have the ability to relate well to students. Science laboratory assistant should have the capacity to take on responsibility and work independently and should possess a very high level of organizational skills.

Science laboratory staff should not be in sole charge of students, except in emergency situations.
Under the direction of the Science Teachers, Science laboratory assistant provide technical support to the students in a range of areas, with particular emphasis on:

* the timely preparation of laboratory equipment and materials for science classes
* employing safe work practices in the science laboratory by applying Occupational Health and Safety legislation
* safe storage and disposal of chemicals and biological residues in accordance with regulations
* safe storage of laboratory equipment and materials
* specialist cleaning of laboratory equipment and laboratory preparation areas

Company Profile: Paragon International School (Paragon ISC) is one of Cambodia's international/bilingual schools, enrolling over 1100 students. Paragon ISC is controlled by The School Board. The administration and teaching staff represent over 20 different countries. The average teaching experience of Paragon ISC teachers is over 10 years. Our primary focus is on internationalism in order to create open-minded world citizens who have an international perspective, are self-confident and conscientious, and who can function as leaders and team members in societies all over the world.Paragon ISC is certified by the Cambodian Ministry of Education and it is accredited by CIS (Council of International Schools). Paragon ISC is also a  Cambridge Exams and PD Centre. Students may enter Cambridge tests and receive a certificate.Paragon ISC graduates have been accepted at many prestigious universities around the world, such as Australia, Japan, New Zealand, USA and more.

Job Description: #NAME?
Job Requirement:
Make a Positive Impression
- Be clean and professional looking.
- Follow dress code and wear your identification badge at all times.
- Greet guests and co-workers with a smile
- Offer to assist customers when a visitor or guest appears to be lost. 

Respect and Caring
- Listen to customers with empathy; be courteous and do not use jargon.
- Keep noise to a minimum; never "talk over" a guest.
- Treat other employees as professionals deserving courtesy, honesty and respect.
- Welcome new employees.
- Knock before entering a guest's room.

Innovation
- Apologize for poor service, and fix what is in your control.
- Identify ways to solve problems.
- Offer suggestions.
- Follow up and follow through to get problems resolved.
- Take a personal interest in meeting the needs of the customers.

Dedication
- Take pride in the organization as if you own it.
- Accept the responsibilities of your job.
- Support your co-workers. Do no chastise or embarrass fellow employees.
- Participate in staff meetings and Medical Center events.
- Be an ambassador for the governor's House.
- Adhere to policies and procedures.
- Arrive to work on time.

Exceptional Service
- Our job is to serve our guests and provide high quality service with care and courtesy.
- Anticipate and exceed all customer expectations: "Go The Extra Mile."
- Demonstrate enthusiasm and a high degree of professionalism while performing your job.
- Make a difference.
- Consider the safety and well being of patients in all actions.
Company Profile:
The Governor’s House is an exclusive boutique hotel with 12 rooms in an elegant colonial-style mansion 

located in the heart of BoeungKeng Kang I (BKK I), an area which is known as the best residential area in 

downtown Phnom Penh, located just a 10 minute drive from the Riverfront.   The hotel is only a short drive to 

the Independence Monument, the Royal Palace, the Silver Pagoda and the National Museum.
Contact Info: Contact Information François Sigogneau Administration Manager 096 262 1282 Mao Tse tung Blvd #3, BKK1, Chamkar Morn  096 262 1282

Job Description:
Provide Hospitality To Guests
- Welcoming guests 
- Demonstrating menu knowledge 
- Answering questions 
- Up selling specialty items 
- Describing dishes 
- Taking orders 
- Handling complaints 
- Ensuring guest satisfaction

Ongoing Table Maintenance
- Bring out food 
- Clearing empty plates 
- Refilling drinks 
- Bringing extra items requested by guests 
- Ensuring the food came out as desired 
- Clearing all plates at end of meal 
- Crumbing the table 
- Offering after dinner drinks and dessert Cash handling 
- Thanking the guest for coming in and assisting in any other ways

Sidework
- Wiping down your tables  
- Refilling salt, pepper, sugar, olive oil 
- Emptying and cleaning coffee station 
- Emptying and cleaning up ice tea and soda station 
- Stocking plates, silverware, to-go boxes, bottled water etc 
- Placing items in back fridge 
- Wiping down shelves and server station 
- Wiping down menus 
- Processing waiter credit card slips and cash

Job Description:
- Assigns workers their duties and inspects work for conformance to prescribed standards of cleanliness.
- Investigates complaints regarding housekeeping service and equipment, and takes corrective action.
- Obtains list of rooms to be cleaned immediately and list of prospective check-outs or discharges to prepare work assignments.
- Coordinates work activities among departments.
- Conducts orientation training and in-service training to explain policies, work procedures, and to demonstrate use and maintenance of equipment.
- Inventories stock to ensure adequate supplies.
- Evaluates records to forecast department personnel requirements. 
- Makes recommendations to improve service and ensure more efficient operation.
- Prepares reports concerning department expenses.
- Selects and purchases new furnishings.
- Perform cleaning duties in cases of emergency or staff shortage.
- Examines building to determine need for repairs or replacement of furniture or equipment, and makes recommendations to management.
- Undertake Maintenance report achievement
- Attends staff meetings to discuss company policies and patrons' complaints.
- Issues supplies and equipment to workers.
- Establishes standards and procedures for work of housekeeping staff.
- Advises manager, desk clerk, or admitting personnel of rooms ready for occupancy.
- Records data regarding work assignments, personnel actions, and time cards, and prepares periodic reports.
- Screens job applicants, hires new employees, and recommends promotions, transfers, and dismissals.
Job Requirement:
Make a Positive Impression
- Be clean and professional looking.
- Follow dress code and wear your identification badge at all times.
- Greet guests and co-workers with a smile
- Offer to assist customers when a visitor or guest appears to be lost. 

Respect and Caring
- Listen to customers with empathy; be courteous and do not use jargon.
- Keep noise to a minimum; never "talk over" a guest.
- Treat other employees as professionals deserving courtesy, honesty and respect.
- Welcome new employees.
- Knock before entering a guest's room.

Innovation
- Apologize for poor service, and fix what is in your control.
- Identify ways to solve problems.
- Offer suggestions.
- Follow up and follow through to get problems resolved.
- Take a personal interest in meeting the needs of the customers.

Dedication
- Take pride in the organization as if you own it.
- Accept the responsibilities of your job.
- Support your co-workers. Do no chastise or embarrass fellow employees.
- Participate in staff meetings and Medical Center events.
- Be an ambassador for the governor's House.
- Adhere to policies and procedures.
- Arrive to work on time.

Exceptional Service
- Our job is to serve our guests and provide high quality service with care and courtesy.
- Anticipate and exceed all customer expectations: "Go The Extra Mile."
- Demonstrate enthusiasm and a high degree of professionalism while performing your job.
- Make a difference.
- Consider the safety and well being of patients in all actions.

Job Description:
Our Clients (You will work at):
It began in Cambodia in May 2012. It has teamed up with the most famous Japanese Motorcycle company to provide financial services. Based on this partnership, it can support the purchase of brand-new motorcycles. With presence in 44 outlets all around Cambodia.

The Parent company is in Singapore and has 20 years’ experience in leasing motorcycles in Thailand, Bangkok-based Company has set a long-term business plan to become a leading finance company in the Southeast Asian region.


Job Description:
• Maintains the work structure by updating job requirements and job descriptions for all positions.
• Maintains organization staff by establishing a recruiting, testing, and interviewing program; counseling managers on candidate selection; conducting and analyzing exit interviews; recommending changes.
• Prepares employees for assignments by establishing and conducting orientation and training programs.
• Ensures planning, monitoring, and appraisal of employee work results by training to coach and discipline employees; hearing and resolving employee grievances; counseling employees and supervisors.
• Maintains employee benefits programs and informs employees of benefits by studying and assessing benefit needs and trends; recommending benefit programs to management; directing the processing of benefit claims; obtaining and evaluating benefit contract bids; awarding benefit contracts; designing and conducting educational programs on benefit programs.
• Ensures legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements; conducting investigations; maintaining records; representing the organization at hearings.
• Maintains human resource staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees.
• Maintains human resource staff job results by counseling and disciplining employees; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results.
• Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Benefit:
•Salary is $700.
•Valuable experience in the rapid-growing global financial company
Job Requirement:
• Degree holder with at least 5 years of relevant experience in Human Resources 
• Service-oriented with the ability to interact with all levels of management through excellent presentation and interpersonal skills
• Good command of spoken & written English ( Vietnamese is advantage )
• Excellent negotiation , communication & presentation skill
• Good problem solving , planning & interpersonal skill
• Active , initiative , self-motivated & aggressive
• Calmly, assertive, sociable, good listener


How to Apply

If you are interested, please send us your resume.
If you pass the paper screening, we will contact you for the interview.
Please put the information as below, otherwise you will not pass to the interview.

- Professional Cover Letter
- Comprehensive Resume
- With recent Photo
- State your expectd Salary
- State the position your applying for (indicated above)

Job Description:
** Scope of work
The Human Resource/Admin Officer provides advice and assistance to supervisors and staff. This may include information on training needs and opportunities, job descriptions, performance reviews and personnel policies of the Council.

The position coordinates the staff recruitment process .The Human Resource Officer provides advice and support to supervisors and staff selection and ensures that they have accurate and timely information in order to make effective decisions.

He/she is responsible for maintaining day to day administrative and personnel services in order to meet legislative requirements and support others departments.

1- Provide support to supervisors and staff to develop the skills and capabilities of staff.
- Ensure that accurate job descriptions are in place
- Provide advice and assistance with writing job descriptions
- Provide advice and assistance when conducting staff performance evaluations
- Identify training and development opportunities
- Organize staff training sessions, workshops and activities
- Process employee requests for outside training while complying with policies and procedures
- Provide basic counseling to staff who have performance related obstacles
- Provide advice and assistance in developing human resource plans
- Provide staff orientations including resignation debriefing 
2- Monitor staff performance and attendance activities.
- Monitor daily attendance
- Investigate and understand causes for staff absences
- Recommend solutions to resolve chronic attendance difficulties
- Provide basic counseling to staff that have performance related obstacles
- Provide advice and recommendations on disciplinary actions
- Monitor scheduled absences such as holidays or travel and coordinate actions to ensure the staff absence has been adequately covered off to ensure continuity of services
- Inform affected staff or residents of unexpected absences from work and coordinate actions ensuring the continuity of 
services such as cancellation of events and locating keys
- Update AL (check finger print)
3- Coordinate staff recruitment and selection process in order to ensure a timely organized and comprehensive 
procedure is used to hire staff.
- Provide advice and assistance to supervisors on staff recruitment
- Prepare notices and advertisements for vacant staff positions
- Schedule and organize interviews
- Participate in applicant interviews
Conduct reference checks on possible candidates
- Prepare, develop and implement procedures and policies on staff recruitment
- Inform unsuccessful applicants
- Conduct exit interviews
4- Provide information and assistance to staff, supervisors on human resource and work related issues.
- Develop and implement a human resources plan and personnel management policies and procedures
- Promote workplace safety
- Provide advice and assistance to staff and management on pay and benefits systems
- Explain and provisions of the personnel policy
- Explain employment standards and legislation such as workers compensation, labor standards
- Organize the transitional provisions of employee compensation, pay and benefits when positions are transferred or new positions are funded through contribution agreements and other special funding arrangements
- Attend  meetings to provide information, when necessary
5- Supervise administrative services 
- Manage the filing, storage and security of documents
- Respond to inquiries
- Maintain insurance coverage’s
- Issue permits and licenses
- Assist with preparation and advertising of contract documents
- Administer contract
- Monitor letter in and out (if any)
- Prepare administrative letter (birth certificate ...)
- Arrange training, meeting, track record, minute meeting 
6- Perform administrative tasks as requested by the finance & General Managers.

Job Description:
A Full Time position is available for a motivated General Medicine Physician at our site in Sala Kamreurk, Siem Reap. Must have completed Ultrasound Training by a recognised training provider.

The General Practitioner or General Medicine Specialist must be willing to participate in a 24 hour roster. The Practitioner will have a history of actively participating in the sharing of medical knowledge, will have a willingness to participate in team activities, a history of patient care at a high standard, and will have an understanding of Medical Ethics and Clinical Practice Standards. 

The ideal applicant will also demonstrate a desire to undertake independent learning to improve medical knowledge, clinical skills, inter-personal communication skills, professionalism, and customer service.

The applicant must be willing to abide by, and have knowledge of, the regulations as outlined in the Neak Tep Clinic Internal Regulations, and the Cambodian Labour Law.

All short listed applicants must provide copies of their Medical Credentials, References, and will be required to attend an Interview with Neak Tep Clinic Management.
Job Requirement:
- Hold a Bachelor of Medicine and Surgery recognized by Cambodian Ministry of Education or recognize international Health Service.
- Completed Ultrasound Training
- Applicants should be no older than 50 years of age.
- Willing to learn, improve knowledge and continue learning
- Available for flexible working hours, able to work day and night shifts on rational basis.
- Have at least one year of post graduate clinical experience
- Ability to build good inter-personal relationships
- Good command of English (written/spoken/comprehension)
- Computer literacy
- Able to actively participate in a team environment 

All applicants should send their Curriculum Vitae, Cover Letter and copies of relevant education certificates to the Neak Tep Clinic Human Resource Team:
- via email: hr@neaktepclinic.com
- via post: Clinic Neak Tep, #8, Street Lork Tanoeuy, Vatbo Village, Sangkat Salakúúamroeuk, Siem Reap, Kingdom of Cambodia.
- Contact Telephone: 017 928 655 / 063 6545 500
Contact Info: Contact Information Mao Ravuth  089 529 159 / 098 529 159 No 8, Loeuk Taneuy st., Sala Kamreurk, Siem Rep town, Kingdom of Cambodia.   089 529 159 / 098 529 159

position: Project Manager( បន្ទាន់)
Job Description:
The Project Manager will be responsible for planning, excuting, monitoring, and controlling work schedule and activities for outlet renovation including:
- leading the project team in day-to-day renovation activities.
- Monitoring of project budget.
- Liase with consultants, main contractors and relevant authorities.
- Attend regular site meetings.
- Supervise and monitor the site labor force and the work of subcontractors.
- Oversee quality control and saftety and health matters on the site.
- Resolve any other site related technicial problems encouranged
Job Requirement:
1. Male
2. Good communication and interpsonal skills.
3. Minimum 4 years of experience in project and team managment.
4. Possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills in mamanging the stakeholders in the project.
5. Able to meet project deadlines.
6. Ability to make and influence key decisions.
7. Proven track records of successful project implementation.

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.

Job Description:
• Develop, manage and coordinate the activities of facilities, design professionals and vendors to ensure that facilities services, maintenance, upkeep and planning of upgrading of assets are completed within time, cost, and quality constraints. 
• Procurement and management of vendor services. 
• Ensure bidding and award of contract service procedure is followed appropriately. 
•Resolve schedule and budget issues in a timely fashion on facility projects. 
• Participate in final inspections, ensure all deficiencies are remedied, and coordinate final acceptance by user. 
• Supervise subordinate personnel including: hiring, determining workload and delegating assignments, training, monitoring and evaluating performance, and initiating corrective or disciplinary actions. 
• Manage the personnel responsible for the upkeep and appearance of the facility and grounds. 
• Ensure that all vendors and on-site vendors procured by the Facilities Manager are aware of and adhere to all Company Safety Procedures and they so signify by signing the proper documentation. 
• Interface with other departments, vendors and supplier personnel. 
• Responsible for department budget process and audit the same to ensure that goals are met. 
• Responsible for effective communications levels and foster team building. 
• Responsible for adherence to all safety procedures and good housekeeping standards. 
• Identify and recommend opportunities for cost savings. 
• Build a strong facilities team in order to support it operationally.
Job Requirement:
• Male or Female 
• Bachelor’s degree and 05 years of facilities management experiences 
• Proven organizational and supervisory skills. 
• Excellent understanding of computer applications. 
• Engineering/mechanical background, Facility Maintenance, Safety,Health & Environment, Security or Janitorial Services. 
• Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment 
• Responsibility for follow-up on actions based on various team projects 
• Building strong internal and external relationships using effective verbal and written communication skill 
• Develop and execute strategies for office centers and facilities. 
• Problem solving skills 
• Must be a provider of excellent customer service

Job Description:
Credit Review:
- Preparing the review list for all loan customers and tracking review dates
- Attending to the existing loan customers for enquires.
- Gathering the updated information from the customers
- Assessing and reviewing of customer’s business performance and industry trends upon review
- Conducting facilities review for management’s approval
- Conducting credit risk rating
- Checking the correspondence regarding the reviewed facilities

Credit Control:
- Controlling security items
- Checking the securities checklist
- Checking the reports sent by credit clerk (daily report, month end report, NBC report, etc)
- Controlling on the monthly payment of interest, commitment fee, instalment and other bank’s loan fee
- Checking the smooth operation of the exiting Smart bank system and assisting in FlexCube system upgrading.
- Maintaining an accurate credit database by ensuring customer records and transactions are recorded/ processed on the system in a timely and accurate manner.
- Maintaining appropriate records, files and documentation in accordance with guidelines and Policy in support of all credit facilities
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field
- 2-3 years of experience in loan processing at Commercial Banks
- Good verbal and written communication skills in English. Verbal and/or written Chinese Mandarin is an advantage.
- Strong analytical
- Ability to work well autonomously and as part of a team
- Ability to read and interpret commercial credit bureaus, analyze trade experience, and utilize external financial resources to underwrite credit requests
- Proficient working knowledge of Windows and Excel
- Typing skills required
- Phone etiquette skills required
- Strong customer service skills

Job Description:
- Responsible for the pool of Operators and will work with the request of Project Managers for Operators.
- Will manage the resource allocation database to provide accurate estimates of project allocations.
- Will collaborate with the Work Force Development Head to make sure that skills needed to meet pipeline needs are clearly defined and planned. 
- Will communicate company policies down to the level of the Operators.
- Would manage the group of Supervisors working both on morning and afternoon shifts and see to it that the Supervisors do their function well.
- Escalation point of Supervisors when they have problems with the Operator/s that they can’t solve by themselves.
- Prepares performance appraisal of the Supervisors at least once a year.
- Find ways and means on how to improve the skills of the Supervisors.

** Context/Environment
Digital Divide Data (Cambodia) Inc.  Internationally acclaimed social enterprise and Impact Sourcing Service Provider, we create jobs for talented young men and women who deliver high-quality content business process outsourcing services to clients globally. This business empowers our staff with the skills and experience they need to lift themselves out of poverty.

Founded in 2001, our proven Impact Sourcing model develops a strong workforce in countries with untapped talent. We identify and recruit motivated, disadvantaged youth who would not otherwise have access to good jobs or higher education. We then train and employ them at a fair wage, while offering them scholarships to attend university..
Job Requirement:
** Knowledge, Skills & Experience
- Fluent in English (reading, writing and speaking).
- Strong character and can make tough decisions and be accountable for them.
- Very analytical which would be of value in the resource allocation part of the job.
- Very good in reporting making use of MS Word, Excel or Power Point.
- Good communication skills in Khmer when dealing with the Supervisors and Operators.
- At least 2 years of relevant working experience.

** Key Success Factors
- PM are allocated with the correct number of operators with appropriate skills for their project.
- Operators are following company policies and core values.
- Supervisors are effective in dealing with the Operators. 

** Working Relationships
- Internal: VP of Operations, Operations Director, Project Managers and Supervisors and Associate VP of Work Force Development
Company Profile: Digital Divide Data (DDD) is a social enterprise established in 2001 to create jobs and build skills in developing countries by providing IT services to business and public sector customers. DDD's vision is to create better futures for disadvantaged people in the developing world.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms. Sreynich Phon  023 220 843 #559, St. 271, Sk. Toul Tom Pong II, Kh. Chamkamon, Phnom Penh.  023 220 843

Job Description:
- See the location to install the electronic appliances
- Install electronic appliances
- Do repairing for customer’s appliance at their home or in the company
- Do maintenance every 3months during the warranty 
- Corporate with the services team to do services for customers 
- Disassemble appliances so that problems can be diagnosed and repairs can be made.
- Bill customers for repair work, and collect payment.
- Trace electrical circuits, following diagrams, and conduct tests with circuit testers and other equipment to locate shorts and grounds.
- Service and repair domestic electrical and/or gas appliances such as clothes washers, refrigerators, stoves, and dryers.
- Replace worn and defective parts such as switches, bearings, transmissions, belts, gears, circuit boards, or defective wiring.
- Talk to customers or refer to work orders in order to establish the nature of appliance malfunctions.
- Reassemble units after repairs are made, making adjustments and cleaning and lubricating parts as needed.
- Record maintenance and repair work performed on appliances.
- Provide repair cost estimates, and recommend whether appliance repair or replacement is a better choice.
- Conserve, recover, and recycle refrigerants used in cooling systems.
- Maintain stocks of parts used in on-site installation, maintenance, and repair of appliances.
- Clean and reinstall parts.
- Observe and test operation of appliances following installation, and make any initial installation adjustments that are necessary.
- Refer to schematic drawings, product manuals, and troubleshooting guides in order to diagnose and repair problems.
- Clean, lubricate, and touch up minor defects on newly installed or repaired appliances.
- Install appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, and stoves.
- Disassemble and reinstall existing kitchen cabinets, or assemble and install prefabricated kitchen cabinets and trim in conjunction with appliance installation.
- Do other tasks assign by supervisor.
Job Requirement:
- Bachelor in Electronic or related field.
- Previous work-related skill, knowledge, or experience is required 
- At least one or two years of training involving both on-the-job experience and informal training with the technical/electrical skills.  
- At least 2 years experiences in Electronics Troubleshooting, Home Appliance Maintenance. 
- Experience in analyzing information, judgment, client relationships, equipment maintenance etc. 
- Repairing — repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

Job Description:
Our client is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, ready-to-drink coffees, and juices and juice drinks. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy our beverages at a rate of 1.9 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. Together with our bottling partners, we rank among the world's top 10 private employers with more than 700,000 system associates. Currently, We are looking for the qualified candidate to fill the position Graphic Designer Team Leader.

- Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop and other design programs

- Computer literacy: Ms. Office, email & internet
- Good at English communication

Job Description:
Our client is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, ready-to-drink coffees, and juices and juice drinks. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy our beverages at a rate of 1.9 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. Together with our bottling partners, we rank among the world's top 10 private employers with more than 700,000 system associates. Currently, We are looking for the qualified candidate to fill the position  Promotion & Innovation Executive.

+ Responsibilities:

- Build and maintain relationship with customers

- Good level of speaking and writing English

Job Description:
- Ensure recruitment of quality staff in accordance with the required manpower plans.
- Ensure that the employees are getting the things that they need according to the company policies and market level.
- Makes sure that the employer has a good employee that works hard and producing good quality work. 
- Be responsible for workforce planning to make sure that all departments have enough people on each shift. 
- Manage recruitment of qualified people no matter what department makes the request for new employee and does the induction and orientation of the new employee before they are sent to the department for training. 
- Takes the lead in the personnel administration section keeping track of all the employees. 
- In charge of salary scale, raising, compensation and benefits.  
- In charge of time cards and making sure that each department stays within their limit of payroll hours. 
- Do performance appraisal 
- In charge of monitoring employee’s behavior and conflict resolution.
- Manage working environment, including security and safety.
- Create, develop and use internal tools and system for all staff work flow control such as: -Time IN/Time Out; Time Off, Annual Leave, Sick Leave, Absence, Over Time
- Control and send to top management all monthly report or special report.
- Be responsible to keep all data update in the HR data base.
- Prepare and submit OT forecast to top management as required
- Prepare a performance management Plan, and create documents, forms and tool necessary for evaluation and appraisal as required
- Conduct and overview employee evaluation, monthly, per quarter and yearly.
- Prepare, organize and implement staff training, both internal (with department manager) and external (with school and organizations)
- Compensation and benefits administration,
- Company employee communication,
- Employee relations, and conflict regulation,
- Employee safety, welfare, wellness and health,
- Do other tasks assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirement:
- BBA in management or appropriate related field (HR discipline is a plus).
- More than 2 years work experience at 200 over employee.
- Familiar with labor law.
- Experience in HR policy development and execution, and best HR practices.
- Experience in conducting management and other training programs.
- Proven experiences in operational HR planning and execution. 
- Working knowledge of or potentials to do job analyses, designs, and evaluation.
- Human relations skills including broad and in-depth experience to understand, recruit, retain, develop and motivate people. 
- Good negotiation, leadership, and influencing skills.
- Positive attitude, good interpersonal and communication skills.
- Prioritize effectively and work to tight deadlines.
- Strong adaptability and sense of responsibility.
- Strong team work, self-motivated, and committed to result.
- Willing to learn and hard-working.
- Ability to work under pressure.
- Computer skills.
- Good command of English.  

*** How to Apply
Interested candidates are invited to apply by sending a Cover Letter and CV with expectation salary and a recent photograph hrsupport@cmedgp.com Only short listed applicants will be contacted for an interview. Address: #A1Eo, St 142, Western Sorya Shopping Center, Phnom Penh

Job Description:
Have you ever considered a ?

The American University of Phnom Penh is seeking Library Assistants to begin work with the University Librarian and begin a career in Librarianship. This is an opportunity to learn new skills and work with an experienced librarian.   

We live in the Information Age and there is so much information available that students, scholars, and the general public need your help to find the information they need. Build a career that is constantly evolving, that has new resources and methods, and uses the latest technology. There are libraries everywhere on Earth. Maybe YOU should find a place in this profession so that you can be an Information leader!
Job Requirement:
Library Assistant will work with the University Librarian in daily tasks of the library and receive training to further develop skills in this field.  

Qualifications:
•Excellent  written and spoken English skills
•Good technology skills
•Bachelor’s Degree; preferably in Library Science, Information  Technology, Humanities, or Social Science
•Library work experience as a student employee, or on the library staff is preferred 


Applicants should submit a letter of application, a current CV, unofficial transcripts, and the names, emails and phone numbers of three references.  

Any questions and applications should be directed to Human Resources at careers@aupp.edu.kh.  Visit us at www.aupp.edu.kh and on Facebook.
Company Profile: American University of Phnom Penh (AUPP) is an independent, private, English language higher education institution, based on the American model of liberal arts education, grounded in the culture of Cambodia and fostering an environment that embraces cultural diversity.  The University offers high quality undergraduate and graduate liberal arts and professional education.  The University educates students in an environment of academic excellence, preparing them to be outstanding ethical leaders who will make significant contributions to Cambodia, the ASEAN region and the world.

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ngoy Manith (Mr.)   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003 No.36, St.169, PPIU Building, 4th Floor, Veal Vong, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh, Cambodia   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003

Company Profile:
Welcome to Aplus Group

We welcome you to Aplus Consulting, considered Cambodia’s most sort after human resource partners. Established in 2008 to provide human resource and tax solutions to local and international companies in Cambodia. Our young and dynamic company has experienced significant growth and now partners with more than 100 organisations, with almost 1,000 employees placed throughout the country.1

We have built a strong team of highly qualified and experienced local and international professionals, bringing their knowledge and expertise of legal, accounting, employee migration, talent acquisition and human resource management and development. We measure our own success from the trust our clients continue to place in us to provide sustainable support services and to grow their human potential.

We sustain the heart we bring to business with our commitment to community development. We partner with universities, scholarship programs and village education to support the academic advancement of young Cambodians. We demand a lot from our team and we commend them for the extra mile they go to volunteer their time, providing on call support for village to city migrating students and  preparation for work  advice and coaching.

We sincerely thank our team, our partners, our clients for helping us to reach a stage where we can proudly hold up SME1 Asia Awards 2012. We promise to only get better at our work and our services for our sustainable success for all.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ngoy Manith (Mr.)   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003 No.36, St.169, PPIU Building, 4th Floor, Veal Vong, 7 Makara, Phnom Penh, Cambodia   017 206 333/010 200 005/023 991 003

Job Description: #NAME?
Job Requirement:
-Have at least 01- 02 year experience in banking operation management and specialist in banking law or commercial enterprise (Corporate/commercial)
-Good comment in both Khmer, English
-Computer literacy i.e Khmer and English Typing, Ms Word, Excel, Power Point, and so on
-Self-directed and self-motivated team player
-Pleasant personality
-Willing to work under pressure and overtime
Company Profile:
Sacombank (Cambodia) Plc. is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sacombank - one of the leading commercial banks in Vietnam and continuously growing in Cambodia and Laos with more than 15,510 employees and nearly 567 branches in the region.

On 23 June 2009, Sacombank became the first Vietnamese bank opened its Branch in Cambodia. In pioneering the entry into the Cambodian banking sector, Sacombank makes a significant contribution in cross-border trade expansion between Cambodia and Vietnam.

After 02 years operating in Cambodia, on 01 October 2011, Sacombank has transformed its Phnom Penh Branch into 100% foreign-owned bank under the official name of “Sacombank (Cambodia) Plc”. After the transformation, the bank continuously reform its operation, cooperate with international strategic partners, develops new products and services to meet the characteristics of local financial market and become a more competitive banking service provider in Cambodia.
Contact Info: Contact Information Human Resource    60 Preah Norodom Bvld, Phnom Penh

Job Description:
•Focusing on sales activities to existing and new-to-bank customers by selling banking products and services.
•Achieving personal target
•Generation of new business via direct sales and / or telesales activities
•Use of effective sales plan to achieve personal target
•Providing customer service at good quality and service standards as set out by the Bank
•Attending regular training in order to provide competent service excellence to customers
•Ensuring compliance with the Bank’s policies and standards, local laws and regulations
Job Requirement:
•University / College Degree in Banking/Finance/Business Administration/Marketing or relevant
•At least 2 years experience in banking sector 
•Khmer and English proficiency in both writing and speaking skill
•Ability to work under pressure and in a team as well as work independently
•Focused, achievement-oriented, excellent customer service oriented
•Strong skills of negotiation and presentation;
•Good sales and communication skills
•Self-motivation and high commitment
Company Profile:

Contact Info: Contact Information Human Resource    60 Preah Norodom Bvld, Phnom Penh

Job Description:
** Sales & Marketing - Phnom Penh (can travelling to province) (3 Position) 

- Listening to customer requirements and presenting appropriately to make a sale
- Do promotion activities, and also sell at the same time.
- Sales duty and try to find strategic how to meet sales target
- Extend more customers and keep good relationship
- Coordinate and explain customers to know well our company's policy and term of payment
- Do market survey and study on market that effect to our sales then give feedback to company
- Give feedback and report to supervisor about market situation to improve our sales
- Follow up customers' selling of stock consignment
- Can work in team
- Other take is under Sale & Marketing manager
Job Requirement:
- Cambodian men having Bachelor degree in relevant field,
- Experience at least one year in sales & marketing (field of Machinery products is plus)
- Be flexible and learn fast
- Be Honest, friendly, good manner
- Be able to deal with difficult situation
- Be able to handle multi-tasks
- Be able to speak Korea (is advance)
- Good command of written and spoken English
- Good appearance with self-confident
- Good in problem solving
- Computer literacy: Word, Excel, and Email
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms. Chhun Many (Admin officer)  023 430 436 / 081 30 96 96 (Office) National Road No. 6A, Sangkat Chroy Changva, Khan Russei Keo, Phnom Penh (Opposite Rumchang restaurant , 6 Km from Chroy Changva bridge and on the left hand side from Chroy changva bridge) Kingdom of Cambodia  023 430 436 / 081 30 96 96 (Office)

job title: Trade Lane and Network Sales Manager ($ 1000 ～ $ 2000)
position: Trade Lane and Network Sales Manager ($ 1000 ～ $ 2000)
Job Description:
•Accountable for the strategy and campaign development for each focus trade lane, in collaboration with paired Network locations 
• Responsible for the delivery of budgets and targets on each focus trade lane, from both volume and CM1 perspectives
• Responsible for the development of trade lane-specific presentation collateral and campaign material
• Responsible for generating Sales leads that contribute to the development of a robust pipeline controlled at Network paired locations in focus trade lanes.
• Responsible for developing and maintaining a must-win customer list, containing controlled and non-controlled business opportunities in focus trade lanes from all the Sales channels and across all products.
• Responsible for both directly owning opportunities and personally contributing to the closure of the Field Sales-owned opportunities (from the must-win customer list).
• The Trade Lane and Network Sales Manager will be the single point of contact and owner at origin of all SCM related opportunities.
• Collaborate with Product and Carrier Management/Procurement teams both locally and in network paired locations to develop new and differentiated trade lane-specific products, customer value propositions and “go to market” strategies. Responsible for providing a point of escalation for focus trade Lanes; Responsible for visiting existing and potential customers overseas and contributing to the closure of opportunities in focus trade lanes controlled in Network countries. Responsible for supporting Network paired locations in the tender process for large opportunities in focus trade lanes.
Job Requirement:
• Minimum of 2 years in some sort of commercial management responsibility within an international business environment • Proven track record in Logistics and Freight Forwarding – and preferably in trade lane management/development 
• Driving commercial development in a complex, network business environment (competitive market, multicultural organization, global network, matrix structure, many and changing stakeholders)
• Written and spoken English and Mandarin proficiency(Korean or Japanese is an advantage) 
• Working experience in one or more of the Trade Lane countries is an advantage 
• Willing to travel; Solid understanding of freight forwarding and international supply chain management programs 
• Account management – preferably of key accounts 
• Project management 
• Sales and pipeline management, including CRM 
• Good operational and product knowledge 
• Analytic and negotiation skills 
• Leadership and people management 
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills 
• Passion, initiative and drive to continuously develop and service clients with creativity, innovation, and dedication • Knowledge of international trade 
• Network / contacts within the international logistics industry 
• Mindset and values in line with the APMM Group values

Job Description:
Our client is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, ready-to-drink coffees, and juices and juice drinks. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy our beverages at a rate of 1.9 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. Together with our bottling partners, we rank among the world's top 10 private employers with more than 700,000 system associates. Currently, We are looking for the qualified candidate to fill the position  Channel Development Officer-RED.

+ Responsibilities:
- Communicate/share picture of success (PixOS) to sales team
- Ensure the PixOS/Right Execution Daily (RED), Diamond Outlets and On-premise activation on target
- Prepare weekly To-Do List to respective areas-Phnom Penh and Provinces sales teams
- Prepare monthly RED Reports by ASM & Sales Representative
- Prepare the action plans and discuss with sales manager, implement and track action taken
- Coordinate with RED Tracking Team (Phnom Penh & Provinces Auditors) in respective area if needed
- Support brand activation with sales team according to Annual Marketing Calendar
- Coordinate special projects as per agreed time frames and format
- Coordinate the MIT days in Phnom Penh and provinces and POSM allocations in respective areas.

+ Requirement:
- PC skills	Word    /   Excel    /   Outlook    /   PowerPoint
- Bachelor degree Marketing or Sales
- Minimum of 1 year experience in Marketing or Sales
- Be able to drive a pickup truck for working (carried driving valid license is a plus
- Be able to well communicate and coordinate with internal and external customers
- Able to work under pressure
- Team winning spirit
- Be able to travel and stay at province

+ Conditions and Benefits:
- Working Time	8.00～5.00PM
- Working Days	Mon / Tue / Wed / Thu / Fri
- Holiday	Sat (Full) / Sun / Legal holiday
- Salary	$ 200 ～ $ 300
- other benefit

job title: 1159_Channel Development Officer-New Emerging Channels ( Siem Reap)
position: 1159_Channel Development Officer-New Emerging Channels ( Siem Reap)
Job Description:
Our client is the world's largest beverage company, refreshing consumers with more than 500 sparkling and still brands. Globally, we are the No. 1 provider of sparkling beverages, ready-to-drink coffees, and juices and juice drinks. Through the world's largest beverage distribution system, consumers in more than 200 countries enjoy our beverages at a rate of 1.9 billion servings a day. With an enduring commitment to building sustainable communities, our Company is focused on initiatives that reduce our environmental footprint, support active, healthy living, create a safe, inclusive work environment for our associates, and enhance the economic development of the communities where we operate. Together with our bottling partners, we rank among the world's top 10 private employers with more than 700,000 system associates. Currently, We are looking for the qualified candidate to fill the position  Channel Development Officer-New Emerging Channels ( Siem Reap).

+ Responsibilities:
- To support brand activation with Business Development Manager in respective areas
- To support the tactical POSM placement (ensure visibility of various POSM at the outlets) at key location
- To track and update the direct marketing expense (DME) of New Emerging Channels by locations
- To coordinate special projects as per agreed time frames and format
- Weekly update reports on activation to channel development manager and sales manager
- To coordinate the MIT days in Phnom Penh and provinces and POSM allocations
